summary: Winning the War on Cancer by Sylvie Beljanski - on Bookshelves
title: Winning the War on Cancer by Sylvie Beljanski - on Bookshelves
excerpt: Winning the War on Cancer by Sylvie Beljanski - OnlineBookClub.org Book of the Day!
description:
Book of the Day January 1st – January 2019 Book of the Month, Rated 4/4

Temporarily Discounted: https://forums.onlinebookclub.org/shelves/book.php?id=264811

Winning the War on Cancer by Sylvie Beljanski

This book has received a PERFECT 4/4 by the OnlineBookClub.org Review Team and has amazing Amazon ratings!

—

On January 1st for only $2.99, get the true story of the discovery of a new and promising approach to the treatment of cancer. This is the Gift of Health at a bargain price of $2.99.

A critical book to read for anyone with cancer. 100% of the author’s proceeds will be donated to The Beljanski Foundation, a 501©(3) non-profit organization, to help fund anticancer research to cure cancer the natural way.

—

*Winning the War on Cancer* is also January Book of the *Month* at OBC! Come get a copy and join in on the discussions for a chance to win one of two $25 Amazon gift cards: https://forums.onlinebookclub.org/viewforum.php?f=172

Grab your copy today:

https://forums.onlinebookclub.org/shelves/book.php?id=264811

summary: The One Negative Thing About Losing Weight
title: The One Negative Thing About Losing Weight
body:
Is there a down side to losing weight? What is it? #weightloss #loseweight #diet #exercise #nutrition #health #howtoloseweight #weightlosstips #weightlosstip #healthtip #healthtips #diettips#diettip

When trying to lose weight, there can be many different things that may get in your way.  Especially once you start seeing the results from losing a large amount of weight.  Many of us would automatically assume that I’m speaking of life events, jobs etc.  Honestly it’s not that at all.  Most of the time your biggest obstacles are going to come the individuals who are around you.

Losing weight…

View On WordPress

summary: Happy New Year! If you don't mind, you said you'd give advice, so I was wondering, how do you set successful goals? I keep...
question: Happy New Year! If you don't mind, you said you'd give advice, so I was wondering, how do you set successful goals? I keep trying to lose weight with my NYRs and it never works :(
answer:
Hi! Happy New Year!

I’m happy to give what advice I can. I definitely don’t have life by the balls or anything, and I certainly haven’t been successful in all of my goals necessarily, but I’ll do my best - and as it happens I have some experience with weight-loss related goals and some of the complications that arise from them.

The first thing is to think about how you define ‘success’. Will you only feel successful if you lose a certain amount of weight, or will a sense of improvement do? In my experience, trying to set a numerical goal can make things more difficult, because it is not very forgiving or flexible, and especially when it comes to weight, can lead to things like calorie-count mentality which is super unhealthy in more ways than one as it makes you focus on the negatives rather than positives and treats food as one dimensional so it doesn’t take into account other facets of nutrition. It can also be very mentally stressful!

On that note, I would also consider why you want to lose weight. Is it to look good, get fit, or for other reasons? There are lots of reasons to lose weight but it is important to decide whether that’s a healthy choice for you (eg. many people with eating disorders are very vulnerable to making unhealthy weight loss goals especially around this time of year, especially in Australia as it’s summer and the diet industry is having a field day). If you’ve decided it is a healthy goal for you, but aiming for a number (eg “lose 10kg”) isn’t working (and there’s lots of others for whom it doesn’t work too, and lots of science on it, but I won’t go there for now) then I would recommend thinking about gearing your goals toward behaviours that would help you lose weight that aren’t necessarily weight-centric. (This is another reason considering why you want to lose weight is helpful as it can help guide you on these).

For example it may be better for you to try a goal such as:

- Eat less fast food
- Eat more vegetables
- Improve positive self-talk
- Do more exercise
- Go for a run/walk/swim etc every day
- Join a sport team or class

You get the idea. Think creatively about your goal and about what you mean by success, and hopefully that should lead to you feeling more committed and fulfilled in the pursuit of your goal. But remember - your New Years Resolution is there to serve YOU, not the other way around. It is supposed to be a little challenging or we wouldn’t bother, but if it is causing you strife, redesign or ditch it. What we promise ourselves on Jan 1st is only as defining of the year ahead as you let it be! 

Hope that helps x

Clara

summary: I’ve been talking very openly about my gender identity recently. Because I’ve come to term with it. I accept it. I’m...
body:
I’ve been talking very openly about my gender identity recently. Because I’ve come to term with it. I accept it. I’m confortable. And that’s because I’ve completed my tattoo sleeve a month ago. It’s crazy the impact that had for me.

Anyway I’ve talked about this on a chatbox with some roleplaying friends, and amongst the 6 people there, 4 of them were having issues that are related. I’m so happy we got to talk about it so openly because we all could relate with one another. It’s not the kind of things people talk about easily and I hope I helped them with my story (because they were all in their early 20s, I’m in my 30s, I’ve come a long way)

I’ll never stop talking so openly about mental heath and gender identity. It helps.

I’m so happy we got to talk about it so openly because we all could relate with one another. It’s not the kind of things people talk about easily and I hope I helped them with my story (because they were all in their early 20s, I’m in my 30s, I’ve come a long way)

I’ll never stop talking so openly about mental heath and gender identity. It helps.
trail.content:
I’ve been talking very openly about my gender identity recently. Because I’ve come to term with it. I accept it. I’m confortable. And that’s because I’ve completed my tattoo sleeve a month ago. It’s crazy the impact that had for me.

Anyway I’ve talked about this on a chatbox with some roleplaying friends, and amongst the 6 people there, 4 of them were having issues that are related. I’m so happy we got to talk about it so openly because we all could relate with one another. It’s not the kind of things people talk about easily and I hope I helped them with my story (because they were all in their early 20s, I’m in my 30s, I’ve come a long way)

I’ll never stop talking so openly about mental heath and gender identity. It helps.

summary: Low-carb? Low-fat? Raw food? What experts are saying about diets
title: Low-carb? Low-fat? Raw food? What experts are saying about diets
body:
Low-carb diets are making a comeback, while researchers are no longer urging people to avoid fats if they want to get skinny.

summary: 46 Creative Ways to Keep Your Fitness New Years Resolutions
title: 46 Creative Ways to Keep Your Fitness New Years Resolutions
description: There are so many reasons to start a new years resolution – eating badly during the holidays; the lack of sunshine in the winter; or just looking at January 1 as a fresh new start.

summary: Too many moving parts: Physicians can’t own it all anymore
title: Too many moving parts: Physicians can’t own it all anymore
body:
A few days ago, I made a call to my neurologist’s office. The fourth call about the same issue. I needed my migraine medication and wasn’t able to get it. I was almost ready to give up and give in to having migraines on a daily basis. None of the usual preventative medications have worked

summary: How Often to Run
